snippet: A village where eight children reportedly were killed this week was struck based on information provided by an informant who meant to mislead the French troops who control the area.
abstract: Afghan government officials say NATO airstrike that reportedly killed seven children and a young adult in eastern Afghanistan was based on incorrect information; officials say they have concluded that an informer had misled French troops who control the area.

byline.original: By ALISSA J. RUBIN and JAWAD SUKHANYAR
byline.contributor: Scott Sayare contributed reporting from Paris.

lead_paragraph: A village where eight children reportedly were killed this week was struck based on information provided by an informant who meant to mislead the French troops who control the area.

headline.seo: Bad Information Led to NATO Airstrike, Afghans Say
headline.main: Informer Misled NATO in Airstrike That Killed 8 Civilians, Afghans Say
headline.print_headline: Informer Misled NATO in Airstrike That Killed 8 Civilians, Afghans Say
